column3: Yagoro needs hard-to-find supplies from hard-to-reach places.
Obtain a crystal from the orange pond.
Obtain water from the green pond.
Deliver the crystal and water to Yagoro.
You are <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, unless I'm mistaken? I have need of your help. Please hear me out.

You would never guess, but I'm in fact a craftsman by trade. With the Front being constantly shorthanded, however, I've become more of a jack-of-all-trades. Most recently, I've been tasked with procuring certain rare supplies, but it's quite beyond one of my humble abilities. Allow me to explain.

To the north of here, there lies a peculiar place called Prism Lake. There you'll find exposed deposits of high-purity crystals which, through some trick of the elements, have changed the waters into the colors of the rainbow.
Well, whatever is responsible for this phenomenon seems to have also made the local Namazu uncommonly savage, making it quite impossible for me to do my job.

However, I believe one of your prowess would have little difficulty. I would be most grateful were you to procure a crystal from the orange pond and some water from the green pond. Rest assured you will be compensated for your troubles.
Were you able to acquire what I asked for?
Wonderful! I knew I was right to entrust the task to you.
But tell me, what did you think of the scenery? The place is quite surreal, is it not?
Legend has it an angel once fell in love with a young nobleman of Doma. Wishing that he joined her in her heavenly domain, she fashioned for him a bridge out of a rainbow.

Alas, the gods were furious that she would bring a lowly mortal to their abode without their permission. And so they destroyed the bridge, reducing it to a thousand thousand pieces, before the nobleman could finish crossing.
The pieces of this bridge fell to the earth and into a lake, where it imbued the waters with their color. So it was that Prism Lake came to be.
Faerie tales aside, prism crystals are prized as an energy source, while prism water boasts potent healing properties. Both will serve us well in our fight.
Right now, we enjoy the lake for its practical gifts, but one day I hope to simply enjoy it for its beauty. My thanks for your help, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
